alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 8:35PM CST until March 08 at 8:10AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Missouri... Meramec River at Pacific. Meramec River near Eureka. Meramec River at Valley Park. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River at Pacific. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Opeechee Beach Road is flooded and closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Sunday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Meramec River Pacific 15.0 15.3 14.3 6.1 3.7 3.0 2.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
